text: Yasmā ca kho bhikkhave viññāṇaṃ anattā tasmā viññāṇaṃ ābādhāya saṃvattati na ca labbhati viññāṇe evaṃ me viññāṇaṃ hotu evaṃ me viññāṇaṃ mā ahosī ti
edit: Yasmā ca kho bhikkhave viññāṇaṃ anattā tasmā viññāṇaṃ ābādhāya saṃvattati na ca labbhati viññāṇe – evaṃ me viññāṇaṃ hotu evaṃ me viññāṇaṃ mā ahosī ti

translations.transtext: Because, monks, consiousness [is] nonself, therefore consiousness exists for illness, and [one] does not obtain the consiousness thus, "May my consiousness be in this way, may my consiousness not have been in this way."
